title: Novad
shortDescription: Emotional city matching platform for digital nomads. Find your next destination based on how you want to feel, not just cost and wifi speed.
detailedDescription:
Novad is an emotional city matching platform that reimagines how digital nomads choose their next destination. Instead of filtering cities by cost of living and internet speed, Novad matches users based on how they want to feel: calm, adventurous, creative, connected.

As founder, I built the entire product from concept to launch. The matching algorithm translates feelings into measurable city attributes and scores 300+ destinations worldwide using real data and nomad testimonies. Users take a 60-second quiz and receive personalized city recommendations ranked by emotional fit.

The platform includes comprehensive city guides for 300+ destinations with detailed sections on neighborhoods, digital nomad life, culture and vibe, highlights, and practical tips. Each guide is written from a remote worker's perspective with structured data for key metrics like monthly rent, internet speed, nomad score, and safety.

Additional features include data-driven rankings (cheapest cities, fastest internet, best community), country directories, a blog on emotional travel planning and nomad burnout recovery, and comparison pages with competitors like Nomad List. Built with a focus on SEO and content quality, Novad positions itself as the feeling-first alternative to spreadsheet-based nomad tools.
imageAlt: Novad platform showing emotional city matching for digital nomads

title: Play Tennis Everywhere
shortDescription: AI-powered tennis partner matching platform connecting players based on availability, location, and skill level.
detailedDescription:
Play Tennis Everywhere is a social tennis platform that revolutionizes how tennis players find partners. As CTO and co-founder, I led the technical development of this comprehensive matching system that uses AI algorithms to connect players based on multiple criteria including skill level, location, availability, and preferences.

The platform addresses a common frustration in the tennis community: the difficulty of finding compatible partners, especially when traveling. Our intelligent matching system analyzes user criteria to propose the most compatible partners, making tennis accessible anywhere.

Key features include AI-powered partner matching based on skill level and location, availability-based scheduling with calendar integration, profile browsing with detailed player information, integrated messaging system for coordination, travel mode for finding partners while on vacation, and personalized recommendations for skill progression. The waitlist launched in August 2025 with exclusive benefits for early adopters including beta access, extended free access, and influence on feature development.
imageAlt: Play Tennis Everywhere interface showing partner matching and scheduling features

title: Fall Corp
shortDescription: A comprehensive platform connecting startups with investors and helping founders build complete teams through talent matching.
detailedDescription:
VentureNexus (initially called Fall Corp) was developed during an innovation program study exchange in Shanghai starting April 2025. This project was built using agile methodology in a team environment, addressing two major challenges in the entrepreneurial ecosystem: connecting startups with suitable investors and helping founders build complete teams.

The platform serves three user types: founders looking to build teams and secure funding, professionals (designers, developers, marketers) seeking startup opportunities, and investors searching for qualified deals. It features an advanced matching algorithm that connects founders with professionals based on required skills and investors with startups based on investment criteria.

Key features include detailed startup profiles with pitch decks and metrics, talent marketplace with skill-based filtering, secure encrypted messaging system, project categorization by sector and development stage, investor verification and accreditation system, document sharing capabilities, and comprehensive search filters for all user types. The platform uses a sophisticated matching algorithm to suggest optimal connections between all parties, creating a complete ecosystem for startup success. Note: The live version is no longer functional due to resource costs.
imageAlt: VentureNexus platform showing startup matching and team building interface

title: Archive Server & Virtual Shell
shortDescription: A custom archive server and virtual shell client built in Bash, enabling remote file archiving, extraction, and interactive browsing via netcat.
detailedDescription:
ArchiveServer is a systems programming project built entirely in Bash that implements a client-server architecture for managing custom file archives over the network.

The server listens on a configurable port using netcat and handles three core commands: LIST (browse available archives), GET (download an archive), and PUT (upload an archive). It stores archives in a local directory and logs all operations.

The virtual shell (vsh) is the client-side tool that communicates with the server. It supports four modes:
- Create: Recursively traverses the current directory, builds a custom archive format with a header (metadata: paths, permissions, sizes, offsets) and body (file contents), then uploads it to the server.
- Extract: Downloads an archive and reconstructs the full directory structure locally, restoring file permissions.
- List: Queries the server for all available archives.
- Browse: The most advanced mode, an interactive virtual shell that lets you navigate an archive as if it were a live file system. Supports ls (with -a, -l flags), cd (with absolute/relative paths and ..), cat, mkdir (-p for nested), touch, and rm (recursive for directories).

The browse mode works by parsing the archive's header to maintain a virtual current directory pointer, enabling full navigation without extracting. The archive format uses a custom structure with line-based offsets for efficient random access to file contents.
imageAlt: Archive Server and Virtual Shell terminal interface

title: Pocket Imperium
shortDescription: A Java implementation of the strategic space conquest board game with both GUI and console interfaces.
detailedDescription:
Pocket Imperium is a digital adaptation of the acclaimed strategic board game where 2-4 players compete for galactic dominance. This Java implementation features both a graphical user interface and console-based gameplay, making it accessible for different play styles.

The game is a quick-playing 4X space game (eXplore, eXpand, eXploit, eXterminate) where players simultaneously choose commands to move their fleets, expand their empires, and develop their systems. The digital version faithfully recreates the strategic depth of the original board game, including its unique command selection mechanic where players must anticipate their opponents' actions.

Key features include dual interface support (GUI and console), turn-based strategic gameplay with simultaneous command selection, fleet movement and combat system, territory expansion and control mechanics, victory point tracking, and multi-player support for 2-4 players. The game emphasizes quick decision-making and strategic planning, with games typically lasting 30-45 minutes. Built entirely in Java, it demonstrates object-oriented programming principles, game state management, and user interface design.
imageAlt: Pocket Imperium game interface showing space conquest gameplay

title: Tiny Habits
shortDescription: A visual, mobile-first finance tracker for college students with a customizable drag-and-drop dashboard, budget tracking, and savings goals.
detailedDescription:
Tiny Habits is a finance tracking app designed specifically for college students who want to build better spending habits. Built during our exchange semester at Shanghai University (Spring 2025) as part of the Innovation Period program, it won awards for Best Public Speaking and Outstanding Business Potential.

The app features a fully customizable drag-and-drop dashboard where users can arrange, resize, and toggle widgets including balance overview, expense charts, category breakdowns, savings goals, a coffee counter, and a good financial decisions tracker.

Key features include transaction management with income/expense tracking, need vs want classification, and search/filter capabilities. Budget tracking with monthly limits per category and visual progress bars. Savings goals with target amounts, deadlines, and progress visualization. AI-powered auto-categorization of transactions using the OpenAI API.

The dashboard is built with @hello-pangea/dnd for smooth drag-and-drop reordering, Recharts for data visualization, and shadcn/ui for a clean, modern interface. The app gamifies financial habits with challenges, tips, and streak tracking to keep students engaged.

title: Translate Project
shortDescription: AI-powered video transcription and subtitle translation pipeline. Transcribe speech, enhance subtitles, and translate from English to French.
detailedDescription:
Translate Project is a full-stack pipeline that converts video files into translated subtitles. It combines speech recognition, subtitle post-processing, and machine translation into a single workflow.

The backend uses FastAPI to expose two endpoints: /transcribe (powered by faster-whisper for speech-to-text) and /translate_srt (using Meta's M2M100 multilingual model for ENâ†’FR translation). A Streamlit frontend provides an intuitive UI for uploading videos, previewing transcriptions, and downloading translated SRT files.

The translator module includes a subtitle splitter for cleaning and restructuring raw SRT segments, and an AI enhancer that uses a local Mistral 7B model (via llama.cpp) to refine subtitle phrasing for natural readability.

Built as a university project at UTT with a team of three, combining NLP, local LLM inference, and full-stack web development.

title: Portfolio Website
shortDescription: A modern, open-source portfolio template built with Next.js, featuring smooth animations, dark theme, and optimized performance.
detailedDescription:
This portfolio website serves as both a personal showcase and an open-source template for others to use. Built with Next.js 15, TypeScript, and modern web technologies, it demonstrates current best practices in web development with a focus on performance, accessibility, and user experience.

The website features a sophisticated dark theme with smooth animations powered by modern CSS and JavaScript. It's designed to be easily customizable, allowing others to fork the repository and adapt it for their own use. The project showcases advanced Next.js features including the App Router, Server Components, and built-in Image optimization.

Key features include fully responsive design optimized for all devices, elegant dark theme with carefully chosen color palette, smooth scroll animations and transitions, project showcase with detailed descriptions, SEO optimization with proper meta tags and structured data, performance optimization with Next.js best practices, accessibility compliance following WCAG guidelines, and modern UI components using shadcn/ui. The codebase is well-documented and structured to serve as a learning resource for other developers. Available as open-source for anyone to use and customize for their own portfolio needs.
imageAlt: Modern portfolio website showcasing projects with dark theme design
